etymologies: late 16th century: from French logement ‘dwelling’, from Old French loge ‘arbor’ (see lodge)

definitions: a place in which a person or thing is located, deposited, or lodged

examples.text: they found a lodgment for the hook in the crumbling parapet

shortDefinitions: place in which person or thing is located or lodged

definitions: the depositing of money in a particular bank, account, etc.
shortDefinitions: depositing of money in particular bank, account

definitions: a temporary defensive work made on a captured part of an enemy's fortifications to secure a position and provide protection.
shortDefinitions: temporary defensive work made on captured part of enemy's fortifications to secure position and provide protection
